result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicholas A Hage was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged or terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of any restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.    Court advised defendant of the DNA submission requirement.
Obtain and maintain employment, at agent's discretion, commensurate with any programming needs.

Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, the bar areas of restaurants. Defendant may not possess or consume any alcohol, nor be anywhere alcohol is available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.

  Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion. 

Defendant to be subject to random testing by his agent.

May apply for early discharge from probation after 2 years, if his agent is in agreement.

supervisions.notes: A civil judgment is entered for unpaid court ordered financial obligations.

May serve in Monroe County, or anywhere they will accept him.
Concurrent with: any sentence now serving.

State recommended:  1 year jail.  Credit for 169 days.  Attorney Sebion recommended:  9 months jail.  Credit for 169 days.  Court ordered:  1 year jail. Credit for 169 days.  Judgment for unpaid court ordered financial obligations.  May serve jail in Monroe County or where they will accept him.

ADA Melissa Inlow appears for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Betthauser. Plead to Count 1.  DRI remainining count.  2 years probation.  Court advised the defendant of the charge and possible penalties of the charge he is pleading to.  Defendant plead guilty.  Court reviewed the plea questionnaire, constitutional rights and elements with the defendant.  Felony warnings given. Defendant understood.  Defense stipulated that there is a factual basis for the plea.  Court found that the defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently entered his plea and waived his constitutional rights.  Court found that a factual basis exists for the plea.  Found guilty of count 1.  Count 2 dismissed, but read in for sentencing purposes.  State recommended 2 years probation.    The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.  Obtain and maintain employment.  Attorney Betthauser agrees with the State's recommendation, but requests that defendant may apply for early release from probation.  Defendant exercised his right to allocution.  Court ordered:  sentence withheld, 3 years probation.    May apply for early discharge after 2 years if agent agrees.  The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.  Obtain and maintain employment, at agent's discretion, commensurate with any programming needs.  DNA sample and surcharge.  CC.  Random drug testing.    Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, the bar areas of restaurants. Defendant may not possess or consume any alcohol, nor be anywhere alcohol is available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.    Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.
